name: DataBeam
overview: Databeam was acquired by Lotus Development Corp. The company is a provider of real-time collaboration and distance learning software and developers platforms, with clients such as AT&T, Cisco systems, EDS and Microsoft. Databeam is subsidiary of Lotus/IBM. Last year the company had $12.8 million in sales and it now employs 120 people. DataBeam’s server software products that enable Fortune 1000 companies and major organizations worldwide. It specializes in development and ratification of international conferencing standards. The company produces end user products like LearningSpace 4.0, an open, best-of-breed, Web-based e-learning solution and Sametime, a family of real-time collaboration products providing instant awareness, communication, and document sharing capabilities. DataBeam offers standards-based developers’ tools for building third-party communications, networking, and telephony products and services like the The T.120 Toolkit Series.
